definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
the curtain drops/the end of the show

sentences.english: It is called Bronner's CHRISTmas Wonderland in Frankenmuth, Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 它就是密歇根州法兰克幕斯城的布朗纳圣诞乐园。

sentences.english: Adjusts the contrast of the touch screen.
sentences.chinese: 调整触控式显示幕的亮度。

sentences.english: Zha stayed on six or seven months longer in General Wu's residence before finally returning to his own home.
sentences.chinese: 查伊璜在吴六奇幕中直耽了六七月之久，这才回乡。

sentences.english: They dropped in the scenery for the next act.
sentences.chinese: 他们为下一场戏放下了布景幕。

sentences.english: Updated two Act 5 mercenary names to Klar and Tryneus.
sentences.chinese: 第五幕增加两个雇佣兵名字。

sentences.english: Swift renovation screen, the wind around the old sticks of cuckoo.
sentences.chinese: 雨燕翻新幕，风鹃绕旧枝。

sentences.english: The curtain will rise in two minutes;it's time to push off.
sentences.chinese: 过两分钟幕就升起，演出该开始了。

sentences.english: Dropping from the veils of the mourning to where the cricket sings;
sentences.chinese: 降低从早晨的幕幛，到蟋蟀吟唱的地点。

sentences.english: Next on the list for a second-act mission was Stardust.
sentences.chinese: 上一秒钟的幕下一个任务是星尘。

sentences.english: She kept peering through the side curtain.
sentences.chinese: 她不时地从旁边的幕帐向外窥视。

sentences.english: Act IV Back in Seville, the crowd cheers the bullfighters on their way to the arena.
sentences.chinese: 第四幕在塞维尔，群众为斗牛士欢呼。

sentences.english: There were three curtain calls when the performance was over.
sentences.chinese: 表演完了以后谢了三次幕。

sentences.english: Now she's got three curtain calls.
sentences.chinese: 现在她已谢过三次幕了。

sentences.english: Heat preservation and energy saving experiment using aluminized thermal screens in greenhouse was conducted.
sentences.chinese: 用国产缀铝保温膜幕在温室内进行了保温节能实验。

sentences.english: The curtain descended,but the audience was still laughing away.
sentences.chinese: 幕落下来了，但观众仍笑个不停。

definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
to soar/to glide/variant of 詳|详[xiang2]
